title: When I log into the Raspberry Pi, I want it to say 'Welcome'. How can I program it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Rpi has the Linux OS. To be more specific, a custom version of Debian called Raspbian. So, what you looking for is a way to change the default message after login, in Linux. What are the different ways that a message can be displayed to a bash shell after a user logs in? or this, is you use SSH to connect to the machine: Modify the SSH welcome message to include system IP address These tutorials are for Ubuntu, there may be some differences for Debian. Google it.
You want it to say, with audio, “Welcome”? Install moc, or mplayer, and edit your .xinitrc file to play something. Append Something like: mplayer Welcome.ogg
